intro: Scutellaria nervosa f. ternata, commonly known as the three-veined skullcap, is a flowering plant species belonging to the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with distinct, prominent veins. The flowers are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem, and are tubular in shape. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
